main event: On February 19, 1955, there were multiple UFO sightings in San Diego, California. One report described a large blinking red light that alternated with the ground, then moved 33 miles very rapidly. Another report indicated the observation of silver streaks in five formations, resembling a possible meteor shower.
interesting points: One report mentioned a large blinking red light that moved rapidly over a distance of 33 miles, indicating a high-speed and agile movement of the object.
The sighting of silver streaks in five formations with three distinct formations in different configurations suggested the possibility of a meteor shower.
A civilian reported witnessing an object that changed from red to white with no wings, indicating a potential change in the appearance of the object.
A ground-visual observation of an object with no sound, diving slightly before fading out of sight due to distance, lasted for three to five seconds for each flight.
The sighting of the possible meteor shower and the observation of an object changing from red to white led to the conclusion of a potential aircraft sighting and a possible meteor shower.
sighted object: multiple unidentified aerial phenomena including a large blinking red light, silver streaks in formations, and an object changing from red to white
